column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, Endeavour is proud to name GIVIT as its national community giving partner for the next three years, with 100% of funds raised through customer and team events to be distributed by GIVIT to people in need. The partnership has already seen over $2 million in corporate and customer contributions donated since 2019 through Dan Murphy's gifting hub, donation tins at store cash registers, brand partnerships, and annual National GIVIT Days across Australia.
column20: GIVIT, community giving, customer contribution

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: For the eleventh consecutive year, Endeavour's Hotels team in Victoria participated in the June Very Special Kids (VSK) 24-Hour Treadmill Challenge, raising over $139,000. More than 250 Hotels and support team members and their families joined this year's PJ party-themed event, with six treadmills going strong across 24 hours. VSK provides integrated, palliative care for children with life-limiting conditions and critical support for their families.
column20: Very Special Kids, treadmill, critical support

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year in Australia, more than 20,000 people will be diagnosed with breast cancer, and more than 3,000 families will lose a loved one to the disease. Endeavour's ALH Hotels has supported the PA Foundation's Project Pink Campaign for many years, and this year raised more than $70,000 to empower researchers and clinicians at the PA Hospital to give hope to every family facing a breast cancer diagnosis.
column20: Princess Alexandra (PA) Foundation, researcher, breast cancer

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Loud & Proud range continues to grow in support of the Pride Foundation Australia's mental health and homelessness programs for LGBTIQA+ communities. The 2023 range, where 100% of profits are donated, included a Prosecco, RosÃÂ©, Seltzer, pale ale and a zero alcohol Sauvignon Blanc and raised over $179,000. This year, Endeavour commissioned LGBTQ+ artist Meg Minkley to create a piece to bring its Loud & Proud product range to life.
column20: Loud & Proud, Pride Foundation Australia, LGBTQIA+

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour's pubs rocked for Ausmusic T-Shirt Day on 18 November. Teams across the country donned their favourite Australian muso tee and raised over $12,500 for the Support Act. This charity foundation offers crisis relief services to musicians, managers, crew and music workers who are facing hardship and cannot work. The industry has taken a huge hit over the last few years due to the pandemic, and with many of Endeavour's venues offering live music, Support Act is a charity that hits home.
column20: Ausmusic T-Shirt Day, Support Act, music worker

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour's Hotels team and customers in SA raised more than $40,000 for the MS Society SA & NT with 100 donation tins and a range of events throughout the state for the year. Fundraising efforts helped to provide vital services for people in SA and the NT living with Multiple Sclerosis, including MS Nurses, physiotherapy, social support, peer support and a range of well-being education activities.
column20: MS Society SA & NT, vital service, well-being education activity

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Through the annual Parma for a Farmer campaign, Endeavour's ALH raised more than $113,500 in February to support farmers affected by natural disasters. More than 300 ALH pubs took part in the initiative, donating $1 from each chicken parmigiana to Rural Aid, which provides critical support to farmers through financial, well-being and fodder assistance.
column20: Parma for a Farmer, natural disaster, farmer

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Since 2020, Langton's Fine Wine Auctions has hosted the Teen Rescue Foundation Auction. It helps to fund initiatives to discourage and reduce harmful alcohol use among underage teens actively. In 2023, the auction raised more than $23,000.
column20: Teen Rescue Foundation, harmful alcohol use, underage teen

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: Endeavour's approach to responsible service of gambling (RSG) was launched this year through Player Protect, which reflects its long-term commitments at strategic, governance and operational levels. Player Protect captures everything Endeavour does to promote and facilitate responsible gambling, from Endeavour's in-venue policies to the dedicated education and training it provides to its people and the support provided for players outside the hotel with information, education and care programs.
column20: Player Protect, responsible service of gambling, responsible gambling

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: Endeavour has grown its team this year and weighted its resources to help drive its responsibility and compliance strategy. In Hotels, Endeavour appointed a Compliance Manager and has recruited Compliance Specialists this year, covering each State and Territory.
column20: Compliance Manager, Compliance Strategy, Compliance Specialist

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: Endeavour's Leading in Responsibility program is now embedded in each team member's induction and onboarding and covers Endeavour's commitment to responsible service and gambling. In less than 18 months since Leading in Responsibility was developed and launched, 90% of Endeavour's team has been through the program, encouraging each person to consider their role in ensuring its impact on its communities is positive.
column20: Leading in Responsibility, induction, responsible service

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: Endeavour's responsible service principles and Secondary Supply Policy, supported by ID25 and Don't Buy It For Them point-of-sale materials, help its team members refuse minors from accessing alcohol and discourage adults who might seek to obtain alcohol for supply to minors. Many stores also enlist additional security guards during the Schoolies season to support Endeavour's teams.
column20: Secondary Supply Policy, ID25, minor

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: Based on supplier feedback, Endeavour made its Small Supplier Policy permanent. The policy reduces the Group's payment terms to 30 days for approved Australian businesses with an annual revenue under $10 million and 14 days for approved Australian businesses with an annual revenue of less than $1 million. It was initially introduced during the height of the pandemic to provide more favourable terms to smaller suppliers.
column20: Small Supplier Policy, payment term, smaller supplier

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: The Endeavour Partner Portal, launched in November, has already onboarded 128 new suppliers, and a newly created Merchandise Assistance team provides system and process support to its Retail suppliers. This Group has also established a dedicated team to support Endeavour's new small suppliers.
column20: Endeavour Partner Portal, Merchandise Assistance team, small supplier

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: In response to growth in online retail and alcohol delivery platforms, Endeavour developed its Online and Delivery Code, which sets out its commitment to provide the safest, most secure and responsible way to deliver alcohol products. The code is a set of principles to guide Endeavour's compliance efforts and its commitment to continuous improvement. The code details the measures Endeavour will take to assess the effectiveness of its actions.
column20: Online and Delivery Code, alcohol delivery, alcohol product

column6: Political contributions
column7: Endeavour made no known political contributions in 2023.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: Endeavour continued the roll-out of additional training modules for its Hotels team. More than 1,600 team members have now completed Endeavour's industry-leading Responsible Service of Gambling online training module, which covers essential topics such as recognising potential problem gambling and warning signs, interacting with players, and highlighting available support options.
column20: Responsible Service of Gambling, training module, potential problem

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: Over 340 managers and gaming hosts have participated in Endeavour's specially developed Advanced Responsible Service of Gambling, a face-to-face workshop providing more practical and in-depth training around customer interactions. These additional programs surpassed compliance standards and were developed with the Responsible Gambling Council of Canada (RGCC) based on industry-leading practices and the latest research in responsible service.
column20: Advanced Responsible Service of Gambling, a workshop, customer interaction

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: In F23, Endeavour built a dedicated new Responsible Drinking training program for its team, utilising the advice, tips and learning tools that DrinkWise has developed for Australian consumers. The simple module covers the principles of moderation, including information on standard drinks and safe drinking guidelines. It covers factors that can lead to problem consumption and warning signs of misuse and harm.
column20: Responsible Drinking training program, DrinkWise, principle of moderation

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column13: Endeavour's frontline team members in Retail and Hotels are trained and certified in Responsible Service of Alcohol and Responsible Service of Gambling in line with State regulations. Training modules assist Endeavour's team to confidently request and verify proof of age to prevent service to minors, identify and refuse service where required, and record service-related incidents, including refusal.
column20: Responsible Service of Alcohol, Responsible Service of Gambling, training module

column6: Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column13: Endeavour's point-of-sale initiative, ID25, supports its team members to screen a wider range of customers for identification to confirm that only people over 18 are provided service. Team members are trained to ask for identification before the point of sale if a customer looks under 25 and service is refused to any customer in school uniform or unable to produce identification.
column20: ID25, training, customer identification

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning product and service information and labeling
Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
column13: Endeavour is using the prominence and visibility of low and no alcohol categories through its marketing communications, with Zero% content integrated into its key trading period campaigns in-store and online, including the Dan's Daily marketing communications. This marketing is focused on category exposure and encouraging trial by educating customers on trending low and no-alcohol cocktails, drinks for entertaining and product reviews.
column20: Dan's Daily marketing communication, no-alcohol cocktail, no-alcohol category

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Endeavour is operationalising its privacy framework and developing best-practice data collection, protection and deletion policies and standards. Endeavour also continued the roll-out of training for all team members. An internal Education Week in May featured four sessions to educate team members on their responsibilities and raise awareness of emerging privacy trends.
column20: Privacy framework, data collection, deletion policy

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: In F23, Endeavour conducted 64 privacy impact assessments for new systems and processes. Endeavour also adopted a new responsible use of data framework, focusing on embedding privacy by design and responsible use of data principles into the data lifecycle.
column20: Privacy impact assessments, new system, data framework

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: In June, Endeavour's cyber security leaders were industry guest speakers at a special event by GOTAFE, regional Victoria's largest vocational education provider. The team shared personal insights about working in the field, the types of threats they see daily, and Endeavour's approach to mitigating and dealing with cyber risk.
column20: GOTAFE, cyber security, vocational education provider
